column4: How do I do a "boot from local harddisk in grub menu.lst"? I boot grub from usb an want to pass it on to local hd boot.
can't you see the local disks in your grub menu?

Well it's picked up the bcd boot loader but refuses to boot it, and I'm guessing this is probably since grub is on a different disk (usb) than it... can I just use rootnoverify (hd0) to do a localboot?
hmmm.. the different disks shoudn't matter as long as the boot images are correctly configured - the boot loader has an entry for your hd, but won't accept it?
I think rootnoverify wouldn't screw anything up, but I'm not sure thats the problem
can you paste in the bootline config?
As in menu-lst? : http://www.mibbit.com/pb/bQvH7Z  ( I have edited (hd0,0) to (hd0) and removed savedefault, which I was going to try just now, makeactive I added before and made no diff.
Hang on... If grub boots from a disk, it would think that disk is hd0 right?
aha - you're trying to boot a windows partition... this looks good to me - the chainloader is the part that should be telling grub to pass on control to the windows box...
How can I find out what kind of naming grub has?
can you boot into a shell and run df
that should give you a listing of the different disks that are loaded, and where they're mounted
And does grub follow ubuntu's naming so that sda1 > hd0,0 ?
Hmm, seems like windows is hibernated... should probably try without that first...
yeah that coudn't hurt things.... you might want to try asking for answers at #grub as well, since you seem to be hitting some questions on that
Ah, turns out that grub was just seing the main hd as hd1 rather than hd0, since it was booted from usb stick... Not following the ubuntu naming...
